title: WWW Beauty Editors Just Discovered Each Other's “Twin Flame” Fragrances—Here's What Happened
author: Maya Thomas
text: Being an editor is the dream career path for beauty enthusiasts who like to stay on-the-go, practice smart shopping habits, and stay on top of new launches, and enjoy sifting through hundreds of sub-par products to find the stand-outs. It takes a keen eye for design, knowledge of specific formulations, and a journalistic fervor to communicate everything we know about a product into a story that can help cut out all the extra steps it takes to learn what you can about it, and then go in for the buy. Yes, Who What Wear Beauty Editors are pros out identifying the best beauty finds for our audience, but what about for each other?With all the time we spend in each other's company (or, for some of us, remotely in shared Slack chats) enthusing over everything from our top volume-boosting dry shampoos to mistake-proof highlighter, we've gotten to know each others multi-faceted personalties and preferences pretty well. So, when the entire team came together for the first time in a couple years to celebrate this year's Who What Wear Beauty Awards in June, we dove into discussion over fragrances like clockwork. Naturally, I decided to conduct an experiment and investigate what makes a fragrance perfect for someone by asking my fellow editors to select a twin flame scent for each member of the team.Since everyone has a different perception of the people they sit across from or message with every day, I fully expected to see dramatically different results with varied explanations as to why a certain perfume was selected as the twin flame of a beauty editor... but, that's not what happened. Below, I'm sharing the 24 scents that embodies members of our beauty team: from an altogether fresh and nostalgic scent by Henry Rose to one that exudes all things academia by Byredo.Scents For Erin Jahns, Beauty Director(Image credit: Courtesy of Erin Jahns; Nordstrom, Bluemercury; Sephora;) Phlur Father Figure Eau de Parfum Scent Type: warm woodsNotes: waterlily, fig, cassis buds, orris root, iris flower, jasmine dew, skin musks, Madagascar vanilla, patchouli leaf, sandalwood"Maybe this is considered cheating, because I know Erin loves this perfume, but I really think it suits her personality. It has a cool, zen-like quality, thanks to notes of fig, jasmine dew, and cassis, yet it's also comforting and down-to-earth, thanks to warm vanilla and creamy sandalwood. It's a scent for someone who has quiet confidence, an inviting aura, and always maintains a keep-it-cool perspective, even amid a stressful schedule and looming deadlines." — Kaitlyn McLintock, Beauty Editor Nette Thé Vanille Eau de Parfum Scent Type: warm gourmandsNotes: salt accord, cardamom, turmeric root, maté extract, narcissus flower absolute, magnolia flower, orris, vanilla"If you’ve ever even seen a picture of Erin, you know she’s the definition of effortless glam—but after one conversation with her, you’ll come to know her sweet demeanor and warm, welcoming disposition. Because of this, I’d liken her to this cool, unisex vanilla scent I recently discovered and surprisingly approved of (I tend to dislike vanilla scents, but this one hit the sweet spot). It opens with a lilting vanilla base but plumes on the skin with notes of green tea and salt, making this fragrance deliciously unisex and perfect for anytime you want to smell sophisticated, yet inviting—just like our fearless leader, Erin." — Alyssa Brascia, Associate Beauty Editor D.S. & Durga Rose Atlantic Eau de Parfum Scent Type: warm floralNotes: bergamot, petals, lemon oil, linden, rose accord, dune grass, muscone, salt water, white mossErin has one of those warm, welcoming personalities that can put anyone around her at ease. She has a sort of laid-back charm to her that, while it comes across as being effortlessly chic, is also incredibly inspiring. The D.S. & Durga Rose Atlantic Eau de Parfum is my pick for her since it exudes the same soft femininity as our beauty director with blooming notes of petals and rose accord set against sweet bergamot, rusting dune grass, and just a whisper of muscone and salt water. It's a cozy, warm floral I think everyone should have in a well-rounded perfume collection, and gives Erin Jahns energy. Chloé Atelier des Fleurs Cedrus Eau de Parfum Scent Type: smoky woodsNotes: cardamom, bergamot, pink peppercorn, rose, vetiver, sandalwood, cedarwood"Erin exudes calm. She’s always poised, put together, and has the ability to immediately put you at ease, even when you know she has a million projects going on herself. An Erin-inspired fragrance should bottle this chic, laid-back energy, which makes me instantly think of Chloé’s Atelier des Fleurs Cedrus Eau de Parfum. Like our beauty director, it’s elegant and refined yet familiar and comforting." — Jamie Schneider, Senior Beauty Editor Scents for Jamie Schneider, Senior Beauty Editor(Image credit: Courtesy of Jamie Schneider; Nordstrom YSL Beauty; Sephora) DedCool Mochi Milk Eau de Parfum Scent Type: sweet gourmandsNotes: marshmallow, peach nectar, incense, sweet rice milk, vanilla bean, jasmine petals, Australian sandalwood, amber, white musk"If I had to describe Jamie in just three words, I would choose 'smart,' 'savvy,' and 'kind.' While I can't fully explain it, she gives me a distinct Dedcool vibe. While I could reference multiple scents from the brand, I have to choose just one, so I'm going with Mochi Milk. It's a skin scent, which means it doesn't scream, it whispers. Much like Jamie, it's warm, grounding, and has an effortless air, thanks to notes of rice milk, marshmallow, and white musk." — McLintock Clean Reserve Skin Eau de Parfum Scent Type: sheer spicesNotes: bergamot, orange blossom, honeysuckle, warm skin accord, vanilla orchid, sun-kissed peony, salted praline, fresh musks, white cedarwoodJamie gravitates towards sweet gourmands with mouthwatering vanilla notes set against a base of warm spices that border on skin-like, which echoes her warm and welcoming personality. Whether you've known Jamie for a day or a lifetime, talking to her gives the same familiar feeling of talking to an old friend (which can definitely be attributed to her calm and collected personality). Clean Reserve's Skin Eau de Parfum combines sun-soaked notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and peony with a warm skin accord, vanilla orchid, and salted praline for a scent that captures her essence to a 't'. Yves Saint Laurent Opium Eau de Toilette Scent Type: warm spicesNotes: mandarin, bergamot, jasmine, lily-of-the-valley, carnation, vanilla, patchouli, amber, myrrh"Jamie is truly one of the smartest, chicest, and on the sly funniest, people I've ever had the pleasure of working with. Maybe it's her fabulous '70s bombshell hair, but I 100% picture her as a Studio 54 regular if she had lived in NYC 50 years ago. Thus, I landed on YSL's iconic scent Opium. Not only did it launch in 1977, in the heat of the aforementioned Studio 54 era, but the bottle itself looks like an invitation-only party. The notes are spicy, but completely timeless—think mandarin, bergamot, myrrh, jasmine, and carnation." — Erin Jahns, Beauty Director Pehnaligon's Fortuitous Finley Eau de Parfum Scent Type: fresh spicesNotes: violet leaf, salty pistachio, leather"I can’t explain it, but smelling this scent after stopping in the Penhaligon's store in NYC’s Soho immediately made me think of our lovely senior beauty editor, Jamie. A lover of gourmand scents, Jamie favors the sweeter things in life, but I think she aligns with the sophisticated, grown-up version of this saccharine scent. From the artistic packaging to the way this fragrance dries on the skin, this scent exudes sweetness and grace, just like Jamie. It’s slightly earthy and even bookish, which encapsulates her smart, sophisticated, and kind demeanor perfectly." — Brascia Scents for Kaitlyn McLintock, Beauty Editor(Image credit: Courtesy of Kaitlyn McLintock; Sephora; Nordstrom; Bluemercury) Oscar de la Renta Bella Tropicale Eau de Parfum Scent Type: solar floralNotes: pineapple agua fresca accord, red coral accord, citrine accord, ylang-ylang orpur, coconut water, orange flower, roasted tonka bean, sandalwood, ocean mist musk"To me, Kaitlyn is summer—warm weather, bright colors, anything that reminds me of the color pink. Because of this, the fragrance in my collection that reminds me most of her sunny aura is a scent I picked up a few years back that thrives in the summertime: Oscar de la Renta’s Bella Tropicale. This fair-weather scent sparkles with citrine accords, solar florals, and notes of ylang ylang that whisk you away to a hibiscus-laden island with a single spritz. A whiff of this scent conjures images of Kaitlyn’s beach escapades in my mind." — Brascia Henry Rose Windows Down Eau de Parfum Scent Type: fresh citrusNotes: grapefruit, bergamot, jasmine, earl grey, muskWhen I think about Kaitlyn, images of lazy days spent lounging by the pool, blue skies without a speck of clouds, skin that smells fresh with just a hint of musk and something else.... maybe soft florals? Windows Down smells exactly like this, but with the addition of zest grapefruit, bright bergamot, and black tea. The later, when combined with the musk, is the perfect pick for her, since Kaitlyn's personality is down-to-earth and friendly. This is the fragrance for the girl next door you can't help but want to be friends with. Diptyque Ilio Eau de Toilette Scent Type: fruity floralNotes: barbary fig, prickly pear, bergamot, jasmine, iris"Considering Kaitlyn’s warm, sunny aura, I knew I wanted to pick something bright. A solar fragrance, maybe? Then I remembered a recent meeting we had, during which she revealed her ultimate dream job was to become Nick Parker from The Parent Trap with a sprawling vineyard in Napa (same). I immediately thought of Diptyque’s Ilio, which is fresh, green, and basically a golden sunset in a bottle—just swap Napa for the sparkling Mediterranean sea." — Schneider Violette_FR Avec Amour Perfume Oil Scent Type: sheer spicesNotes: ylang-ylang, bergamot, amber, santal, coconut water, vetiver"Considering her unmatched love for the beach, nature, and all things French, I'm convinced Kaitlyn was a mermaid haunting the turquoise waters of Cannes or St. Tropez in a past life. I happen to know that Violette_FR is one of Kait's all-time favorite brands, makeup-wise, and this chic perfume oil epitomizes her effortless and grounded air. To me, the notes like coconut water, white musk, santal, bergamot, and vetiver make it the quintessential summer by the beach scent, which in turn, makes it the perfect Kaitlyn McLintock scent." — Jahns Scents for Maya Thomas, Associate Beauty Editor(Image credit: Courtesy of Maya Thomas; Nordstrom; Sephora) Parfums de Marly Delina Eau de Parfum Scent Type: floral woodsNotes: rhubarb, lychee, bergamot essence, Damascena rose, peony, vanilla, cashmeran, musk, vetiver"When I think of Maya, I think of soft, romantic, whimsical beauty. For one, I know she loves a Rom-Com blush moment. But I also adored watching her fall in love with New York City by way of strolls in Central Park and hours at The Met; she’s inspired me to romanticize the city I’ve called home for nearly seven years. That said, I wanted to select a fragrance for her that has a similar uplifting, idyllic energy. Parfums de Marly’s Delina could not be a more perfect pick with its delicate notes of bergamot essence, Turkish rose, peony vanilla, and musk." — Schneider"To me, a 'Maya' scent would be one that's classic, sweet, and emits a sort of graceful aura, so obviously, I thought of Parfums de Marly Delina. With notes of Turkish rose, bergamot, and lily of the valley, it gives me 'balletcore' vibes in the best way and encapsulates Maya's lyrical voice and timeless style. " — McLintock Dior J'adore Eau de Parfum Scent Type: warm floralsNotes: ylang-ylang essence, Damascus rose essence, jasmine grandiforum, jasmine sambac, lily-of-the-valley, sambac"When prompted to think of the sensorial equivalents of our teammates, my first twin flame connection was to Maya. This classic scent from Dior immediately popped into my brain when imagining her dreamy, bright aura—Maya always being a sophisticated, put-together sight when I see her. A lover of art and the finer things in life, this elegant floral fragrance twines the wearer in a shroud of ylang-ylang, damascus rose, and jasmine, offering an elevated, summery scent that I reach for when I want to smell as chic as Maya." — Brascia Maison Margiela 'Replica' Springtime In A Park Scent Type: fruity floralNotes: pear accord, bergamot essence, blackcurrant accord, lily-of-the-valley accord, jasmine absolute, rose damascena absolute, musk accord, vanilla accord, ambrox"If you know Maya, you know that she has this smiling, radiant energy that instantly lights up the room. She's a spring baby, she typically gravitates toward musky scents, and she also has impeccable, very elegant taste. Replica's Springtime In a Park Eau de Toilette feels like her ultimate twin flame scent IMO—it has this perfectly regal balance of musks, florals like lily of the valley, and fruits, like green blackcurrant and juicy pear. You know when you take a walk outside right when the season is turning and you instantly feel lighter? That's how it feels when you get to know and spend time working with Maya." — Jahns (Image credit: Courtesy of Alyssa Brascia; Nordstrom; Bluemercury; Sephora)Scents for Alyssa Brascia, Associate Beauty Editor Maison Margiela 'Replica' Under The Stars Eau de Parfum Scent Type: warm spicesNotes: black pepper essence, cinnamon leaves essence, cypriol essence, Virginian cedarwood essence, labdanum resinoid, oud infusion, leather accordAlyssa has an outgoing, bold personality and never shies away from a bit of edge and unexpected color in her fashion and makeup choices. While all WWW beauty editors know a thing or two about putting together an on-trend look, Alyssa can bear her soul in every accessory and lipstick shade she wears and make it a high fashion moment. Maison Margiela's 'Replica' Under The Stars Eau de Parfum is reminiscent of her because it combines notes of black pepper and leather with cinnamon leaves, oud infusion, and more for a show-stopping fragrance. Byredo Eleventh Hour Eau de Parfum Scent Type: citrus woodsNotes: bergamot, ban timmur, rum, carrot seeds, wild fig, tonka beans, cashmere woods"Alyssa is cool. There’s no other way to slice it. She has a sharp eye for both beauty and fashion trends, pairing zebra print with paillettes and making them look like they were always part of a two-for-one set. So for her, I wanted to pick a bold perfume with a unique blend of notes—enter Byredo’s Eleventh Hour. A scent profile with carrot seeds and rum might make you raise a brow at first glance, but trust me, the potion just works. It does take a very cool girl to pull off one of Byredo’s more underrated scents, so it’s perfect for AB!" — Schneider Frédéric Malle Portrait of a Lady Scent Type: cloral chypreNotes: rose, blackcurrant, raspberry, clove, cinnamon, patchouli, benzoin, sandalwood, frankincense"I love Alyssa's cool, individualistic, and edgy sense of style. When I was thinking of what scent would encapsulate her spirit, I immediately thought of Frederic Malle's Portrait of a Lady. Why? Because it was iconic when it came out 15 years ago, and it will remain iconic. It's bold, yet sophisticated, and instantly recognizable thanks to a unique formulation of rose, patchouli, sandalwood, and incense. While the original glass bottle will do, I think the limited-edition red bottle really says, 'Alyssa.'" — McLintock Perfumehead Cosmic Cowboy Extrait de Parfum Scent Type: gourmand muskNotes: galbanum, cinnamon bark, orris, lavender, cacao, whiskey a go go, angelica root, tobacco leaf, tonka bean, amber, cacoa blanc, suede black musk"Alyssa is like that effervescent cool girl you instantly want to be friends with and have a girls night out on the town with. She's passionate, incredibly artistic and creative, and just plain fun. I instantly knew that one of Perfumehead's cult-loved scents would be her twin flame, but it took me a little while to put my finger on the perfect one. Ultimately, I landed on Cosmic Cowboy. It's hands-down one of my favorite perfumes of all time, but the brand's description of the fragrance i.e. "the Sunset Strip in the ’70s and neon and smokey club" feels like 'essence of Alyssa,' bottled." — Jahns Scents for Sabrina Talbert, Assistant Beauty Editor(Image credit: Courtesy of Sabrina Talbert; Nordstom; Noyz; Unifrom; Sephora) Unifrom Florum Perfume Oil Scent Type: fruity floralNotes: pear, tuberose, white amber"Vibrant, cool, and collected, Sabrina is no regular perfume to me. I recently tried this crisp and clean floral perfume oil from Unifrom that sparks images of Sabrina in my mind, what with its functional wear (perfume oils last longer on the skin), sleek aesthetic, and easy-to-tote rollerball packaging (perfect her girl on the go lifestyle). Its intricate layers of white florals are accented with pear and white amber to create a clean scent that has surprising depth, and its slim body is easy to throw in a purse or gym bag, which I know Sabrina would appreciate." — Brascia Noyz Lost + Found Eau de Parfum Scent Type: citrus woodsNotes: Italian lemon, Australian pink pepper, jasmine petals, rhubarb, raspberry blossom, cedarwood, crisp amber, pink sugar[INSERT CAPTION] Henry Rose Jake's House Eau de Parfum Scent Type: fresh aquaticsNotes: fresh marine, neroli, peony, jasmine, ambroxan, musk"Sabrina has a fresh perspective on all things beauty, so naturally, I associate her with a fresh scent, like Henry Rose's Jake's House Eau de Parfum (it's one of my favorites). It's a crisp, aquatic scent with notes of marine accord, neroli, and musk. I would like to think it fits Sabrina's sleek style, calm demeanor, and sporty lifestyle." — McLintock Abel Golden Neroli Eau de Parfum Scent Type: citrus floralNotes: neroli, matcha tea, petitgrain, ylang-ylang, jasmine sambac, East Indian sandalwood, vanilla"Sabrina is our resident sports girl on team beauty, so I of course have to shout out one of my favorite gym scents, Abel’s Golden Neroli (which is being slowly phased out, so I might just have to cop it for her, stat). The bright floral is at once sweet and clean, meant to evoke basking in the late-afternoon sun. It has a fresh quality to it that reminds me of the outdoors without being too on-the-nose as a green scent. I could easily see Sabrina spritzing this on before heading out for a run or one of her evening dance classes!" — Schneider Byredo Bibliothèque Eau de Parfum Scent Type: aromatic woodsNotes: plum, cinnamon, leather accord, violet, birch woods, patchouli, vanilla"Sabrina exudes an epic combination of poise, thoughtfulness, and focus. She's incredibly hard-working and has a rare, gentle and kind disposition that instantly puts you at ease—which can be a bit of a magic trick when you work in a fast-paced industry like ours! Byredo's Bibliothèque is such a classically lovely scent, and it's one I associate with comfort and warmth, just like Sabrina's wonderful aura." — Jahns Maya Thomas is an Associate Beauty Editor at Who What Wear. Her strong love for all things beauty and fashion stems from a strong childhood interest in the fine arts. During a gap year spent in Paris studying the history of French fashion, she shifted her focus to English literature and journalism as a student at Loyola Marymount University. After graduating in May 2021, Maya began freelancing for Parade.com as a contributing commerce writer. When she's not writing, Maya spends her free time catching up on reading, perusing art galleries, and enjoying a night out at the ballet every now and then.
html:
Being an editor is the dream career path for beauty enthusiasts who like to stay on-the-go, practice smart shopping habits, and stay on top of new launches, and enjoy sifting through hundreds of sub-par products to find the stand-outs. It takes a keen eye for design, knowledge of specific formulations, and a journalistic fervor to communicate everything we know about a product into a story that can help cut out all the extra steps it takes to learn what you can about it, and then go in for the buy. Yes, Who What Wear Beauty Editors are pros out identifying the best beauty finds for our audience, but what about for each other?

With all the time we spend in each other's company (or, for some of us, remotely in shared Slack chats) enthusing over everything from our top volume-boosting dry shampoos to mistake-proof highlighter, we've gotten to know each others multi-faceted personalties and preferences pretty well. So, when the entire team came together for the first time in a couple years to celebrate this year's Who What Wear Beauty Awards in June, we dove into discussion over fragrances like clockwork. Naturally, I decided to conduct an experiment and investigate what makes a fragrance perfect for someone by asking my fellow editors to select a twin flame scent for each member of the team.

Since everyone has a different perception of the people they sit across from or message with every day, I fully expected to see dramatically different results with varied explanations as to why a certain perfume was selected as the twin flame of a beauty editor... but, that's not what happened. Below, I'm sharing the 24 scents that embodies members of our beauty team: from an altogether fresh and nostalgic scent by Henry Rose to one that exudes all things academia by Byredo.

Scents For Erin Jahns, Beauty Director

Phlur

Father Figure Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: warm woods

Notes: waterlily, fig, cassis buds, orris root, iris flower, jasmine dew, skin musks, Madagascar vanilla, patchouli leaf, sandalwood

"Maybe this is considered cheating, because I know Erin loves this perfume, but I really think it suits her personality. It has a cool, zen-like quality, thanks to notes of fig, jasmine dew, and cassis, yet it's also comforting and down-to-earth, thanks to warm vanilla and creamy sandalwood. It's a scent for someone who has quiet confidence, an inviting aura, and always maintains a keep-it-cool perspective, even amid a stressful schedule and looming deadlines." — Kaitlyn McLintock, Beauty Editor

Nette

Thé Vanille Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: warm gourmands

Notes: salt accord, cardamom, turmeric root, maté extract, narcissus flower absolute, magnolia flower, orris, vanilla

"If you’ve ever even seen a picture of Erin, you know she’s the definition of effortless glam—but after one conversation with her, you’ll come to know her sweet demeanor and warm, welcoming disposition. Because of this, I’d liken her to this cool, unisex vanilla scent I recently discovered and surprisingly approved of (I tend to dislike vanilla scents, but this one hit the sweet spot). It opens with a lilting vanilla base but plumes on the skin with notes of green tea and salt, making this fragrance deliciously unisex and perfect for anytime you want to smell sophisticated, yet inviting—just like our fearless leader, Erin." — Alyssa Brascia, Associate Beauty Editor

D.S. & Durga

Rose Atlantic Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: warm floral

Notes: bergamot, petals, lemon oil, linden, rose accord, dune grass, muscone, salt water, white moss

Erin has one of those warm, welcoming personalities that can put anyone around her at ease. She has a sort of laid-back charm to her that, while it comes across as being effortlessly chic, is also incredibly inspiring. The D.S. & Durga Rose Atlantic Eau de Parfum is my pick for her since it exudes the same soft femininity as our beauty director with blooming notes of petals and rose accord set against sweet bergamot, rusting dune grass, and just a whisper of muscone and salt water. It's a cozy, warm floral I think everyone should have in a well-rounded perfume collection, and gives Erin Jahns energy.

Chloé

Atelier des Fleurs Cedrus Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: smoky woods

Notes: cardamom, bergamot, pink peppercorn, rose, vetiver, sandalwood, cedarwood

"Erin exudes calm. She’s always poised, put together, and has the ability to immediately put you at ease, even when you know she has a million projects going on herself. An Erin-inspired fragrance should bottle this chic, laid-back energy, which makes me instantly think of Chloé’s Atelier des Fleurs Cedrus Eau de Parfum. Like our beauty director, it’s elegant and refined yet familiar and comforting." — Jamie Schneider, Senior Beauty Editor

Scents for Jamie Schneider, Senior Beauty Editor

DedCool

Mochi Milk Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: sweet gourmands

Notes: marshmallow, peach nectar, incense, sweet rice milk, vanilla bean, jasmine petals, Australian sandalwood, amber, white musk

"If I had to describe Jamie in just three words, I would choose 'smart,' 'savvy,' and 'kind.' While I can't fully explain it, she gives me a distinct Dedcool vibe. While I could reference multiple scents from the brand, I have to choose just one, so I'm going with Mochi Milk. It's a skin scent, which means it doesn't scream, it whispers. Much like Jamie, it's warm, grounding, and has an effortless air, thanks to notes of rice milk, marshmallow, and white musk." — McLintock

Clean Reserve

Skin Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: sheer spices

Notes: bergamot, orange blossom, honeysuckle, warm skin accord, vanilla orchid, sun-kissed peony, salted praline, fresh musks, white cedarwood

Jamie gravitates towards sweet gourmands with mouthwatering vanilla notes set against a base of warm spices that border on skin-like, which echoes her warm and welcoming personality. Whether you've known Jamie for a day or a lifetime, talking to her gives the same familiar feeling of talking to an old friend (which can definitely be attributed to her calm and collected personality). Clean Reserve's Skin Eau de Parfum combines sun-soaked notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and peony with a warm skin accord, vanilla orchid, and salted praline for a scent that captures her essence to a 't'.

Yves Saint Laurent

Opium Eau de Toilette

Scent Type: warm spices

Notes: mandarin, bergamot, jasmine, lily-of-the-valley, carnation, vanilla, patchouli, amber, myrrh

"Jamie is truly one of the smartest, chicest, and on the sly funniest, people I've ever had the pleasure of working with. Maybe it's her fabulous '70s bombshell hair, but I 100% picture her as a Studio 54 regular if she had lived in NYC 50 years ago. Thus, I landed on YSL's iconic scent Opium. Not only did it launch in 1977, in the heat of the aforementioned Studio 54 era, but the bottle itself looks like an invitation-only party. The notes are spicy, but completely timeless—think mandarin, bergamot, myrrh, jasmine, and carnation." — Erin Jahns, Beauty Director

Pehnaligon's

Fortuitous Finley Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: fresh spices

Notes: violet leaf, salty pistachio, leather

"I can’t explain it, but smelling this scent after stopping in the Penhaligon's store in NYC’s Soho immediately made me think of our lovely senior beauty editor, Jamie. A lover of gourmand scents, Jamie favors the sweeter things in life, but I think she aligns with the sophisticated, grown-up version of this saccharine scent. From the artistic packaging to the way this fragrance dries on the skin, this scent exudes sweetness and grace, just like Jamie. It’s slightly earthy and even bookish, which encapsulates her smart, sophisticated, and kind demeanor perfectly." — Brascia

Scents for Kaitlyn McLintock, Beauty Editor

Oscar de la Renta

Bella Tropicale Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: solar floral

Notes: pineapple agua fresca accord, red coral accord, citrine accord, ylang-ylang orpur, coconut water, orange flower, roasted tonka bean, sandalwood, ocean mist musk

"To me, Kaitlyn is summer—warm weather, bright colors, anything that reminds me of the color pink. Because of this, the fragrance in my collection that reminds me most of her sunny aura is a scent I picked up a few years back that thrives in the summertime: Oscar de la Renta’s Bella Tropicale. This fair-weather scent sparkles with citrine accords, solar florals, and notes of ylang ylang that whisk you away to a hibiscus-laden island with a single spritz. A whiff of this scent conjures images of Kaitlyn’s beach escapades in my mind." — Brascia

Henry Rose

Windows Down Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: fresh citrus

Notes: grapefruit, bergamot, jasmine, earl grey, musk

When I think about Kaitlyn, images of lazy days spent lounging by the pool, blue skies without a speck of clouds, skin that smells fresh with just a hint of musk and something else.... maybe soft florals? Windows Down smells exactly like this, but with the addition of zest grapefruit, bright bergamot, and black tea. The later, when combined with the musk, is the perfect pick for her, since Kaitlyn's personality is down-to-earth and friendly. This is the fragrance for the girl next door you can't help but want to be friends with.

Diptyque

Ilio Eau de Toilette

Scent Type: fruity floral

Notes: barbary fig, prickly pear, bergamot, jasmine, iris

"Considering Kaitlyn’s warm, sunny aura, I knew I wanted to pick something bright. A solar fragrance, maybe? Then I remembered a recent meeting we had, during which she revealed her ultimate dream job was to become Nick Parker from The Parent Trap with a sprawling vineyard in Napa (same). I immediately thought of Diptyque’s Ilio, which is fresh, green, and basically a golden sunset in a bottle—just swap Napa for the sparkling Mediterranean sea." — Schneider

Violette_FR

Avec Amour Perfume Oil

Scent Type: sheer spices

Notes: ylang-ylang, bergamot, amber, santal, coconut water, vetiver

"Considering her unmatched love for the beach, nature, and all things French, I'm convinced Kaitlyn was a mermaid haunting the turquoise waters of Cannes or St. Tropez in a past life. I happen to know that Violette_FR is one of Kait's all-time favorite brands, makeup-wise, and this chic perfume oil epitomizes her effortless and grounded air. To me, the notes like coconut water, white musk, santal, bergamot, and vetiver make it the quintessential summer by the beach scent, which in turn, makes it the perfect Kaitlyn McLintock scent." — Jahns

Scents for Maya Thomas, Associate Beauty Editor

Parfums de Marly

Delina Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: floral woods

Notes: rhubarb, lychee, bergamot essence, Damascena rose, peony, vanilla, cashmeran, musk, vetiver

"When I think of Maya, I think of soft, romantic, whimsical beauty. For one, I know she loves a Rom-Com blush moment. But I also adored watching her fall in love with New York City by way of strolls in Central Park and hours at The Met; she’s inspired me to romanticize the city I’ve called home for nearly seven years. That said, I wanted to select a fragrance for her that has a similar uplifting, idyllic energy. Parfums de Marly’s Delina could not be a more perfect pick with its delicate notes of bergamot essence, Turkish rose, peony vanilla, and musk." — Schneider

"To me, a 'Maya' scent would be one that's classic, sweet, and emits a sort of graceful aura, so obviously, I thought of Parfums de Marly Delina. With notes of Turkish rose, bergamot, and lily of the valley, it gives me 'balletcore' vibes in the best way and encapsulates Maya's lyrical voice and timeless style. " — McLintock

Dior

J'adore Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: warm florals

Notes: ylang-ylang essence, Damascus rose essence, jasmine grandiforum, jasmine sambac, lily-of-the-valley, sambac

"When prompted to think of the sensorial equivalents of our teammates, my first twin flame connection was to Maya. This classic scent from Dior immediately popped into my brain when imagining her dreamy, bright aura—Maya always being a sophisticated, put-together sight when I see her. A lover of art and the finer things in life, this elegant floral fragrance twines the wearer in a shroud of ylang-ylang, damascus rose, and jasmine, offering an elevated, summery scent that I reach for when I want to smell as chic as Maya." — Brascia

Maison Margiela

'Replica' Springtime In A Park

Scent Type: fruity floral

Notes: pear accord, bergamot essence, blackcurrant accord, lily-of-the-valley accord, jasmine absolute, rose damascena absolute, musk accord, vanilla accord, ambrox

"If you know Maya, you know that she has this smiling, radiant energy that instantly lights up the room. She's a spring baby, she typically gravitates toward musky scents, and she also has impeccable, very elegant taste. Replica's Springtime In a Park Eau de Toilette feels like her ultimate twin flame scent IMO—it has this perfectly regal balance of musks, florals like lily of the valley, and fruits, like green blackcurrant and juicy pear. You know when you take a walk outside right when the season is turning and you instantly feel lighter? That's how it feels when you get to know and spend time working with Maya." — Jahns

Scents for Alyssa Brascia, Associate Beauty Editor

Maison Margiela

'Replica' Under The Stars Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: warm spices

Notes: black pepper essence, cinnamon leaves essence, cypriol essence, Virginian cedarwood essence, labdanum resinoid, oud infusion, leather accord

Alyssa has an outgoing, bold personality and never shies away from a bit of edge and unexpected color in her fashion and makeup choices. While all WWW beauty editors know a thing or two about putting together an on-trend look, Alyssa can bear her soul in every accessory and lipstick shade she wears and make it a high fashion moment. Maison Margiela's 'Replica' Under The Stars Eau de Parfum is reminiscent of her because it combines notes of black pepper and leather with cinnamon leaves, oud infusion, and more for a show-stopping fragrance.

Byredo

Eleventh Hour Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: citrus woods

Notes: bergamot, ban timmur, rum, carrot seeds, wild fig, tonka beans, cashmere woods

"Alyssa is cool. There’s no other way to slice it. She has a sharp eye for both beauty and fashion trends, pairing zebra print with paillettes and making them look like they were always part of a two-for-one set. So for her, I wanted to pick a bold perfume with a unique blend of notes—enter Byredo’s Eleventh Hour. A scent profile with carrot seeds and rum might make you raise a brow at first glance, but trust me, the potion just works. It does take a very cool girl to pull off one of Byredo’s more underrated scents, so it’s perfect for AB!" — Schneider

Frédéric Malle

Portrait of a Lady

Scent Type: cloral chypre

Notes: rose, blackcurrant, raspberry, clove, cinnamon, patchouli, benzoin, sandalwood, frankincense

"I love Alyssa's cool, individualistic, and edgy sense of style. When I was thinking of what scent would encapsulate her spirit, I immediately thought of Frederic Malle's Portrait of a Lady. Why? Because it was iconic when it came out 15 years ago, and it will remain iconic. It's bold, yet sophisticated, and instantly recognizable thanks to a unique formulation of rose, patchouli, sandalwood, and incense. While the original glass bottle will do, I think the limited-edition red bottle really says, 'Alyssa.'" — McLintock

Perfumehead

Cosmic Cowboy Extrait de Parfum

Scent Type: gourmand musk

Notes: galbanum, cinnamon bark, orris, lavender, cacao, whiskey a go go, angelica root, tobacco leaf, tonka bean, amber, cacoa blanc, suede black musk

"Alyssa is like that effervescent cool girl you instantly want to be friends with and have a girls night out on the town with. She's passionate, incredibly artistic and creative, and just plain fun. I instantly knew that one of Perfumehead's cult-loved scents would be her twin flame, but it took me a little while to put my finger on the perfect one. Ultimately, I landed on Cosmic Cowboy. It's hands-down one of my favorite perfumes of all time, but the brand's description of the fragrance i.e. "the Sunset Strip in the ’70s and neon and smokey club" feels like 'essence of Alyssa,' bottled." — Jahns

Scents for Sabrina Talbert, Assistant Beauty Editor

Unifrom

Florum Perfume Oil

Scent Type: fruity floral

Notes: pear, tuberose, white amber

"Vibrant, cool, and collected, Sabrina is no regular perfume to me. I recently tried this crisp and clean floral perfume oil from Unifrom that sparks images of Sabrina in my mind, what with its functional wear (perfume oils last longer on the skin), sleek aesthetic, and easy-to-tote rollerball packaging (perfect her girl on the go lifestyle). Its intricate layers of white florals are accented with pear and white amber to create a clean scent that has surprising depth, and its slim body is easy to throw in a purse or gym bag, which I know Sabrina would appreciate." — Brascia

Noyz

Lost + Found Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: citrus woods

Notes: Italian lemon, Australian pink pepper, jasmine petals, rhubarb, raspberry blossom, cedarwood, crisp amber, pink sugar

[INSERT CAPTION]

Henry Rose

Jake's House Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: fresh aquatics

Notes: fresh marine, neroli, peony, jasmine, ambroxan, musk

"Sabrina has a fresh perspective on all things beauty, so naturally, I associate her with a fresh scent, like Henry Rose's Jake's House Eau de Parfum (it's one of my favorites). It's a crisp, aquatic scent with notes of marine accord, neroli, and musk. I would like to think it fits Sabrina's sleek style, calm demeanor, and sporty lifestyle." — McLintock

Abel

Golden Neroli Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: citrus floral

Notes: neroli, matcha tea, petitgrain, ylang-ylang, jasmine sambac, East Indian sandalwood, vanilla

"Sabrina is our resident sports girl on team beauty, so I of course have to shout out one of my favorite gym scents, Abel’s Golden Neroli (which is being slowly phased out, so I might just have to cop it for her, stat). The bright floral is at once sweet and clean, meant to evoke basking in the late-afternoon sun. It has a fresh quality to it that reminds me of the outdoors without being too on-the-nose as a green scent. I could easily see Sabrina spritzing this on before heading out for a run or one of her evening dance classes!" — Schneider

Byredo

Bibliothèque Eau de Parfum

Scent Type: aromatic woods

Notes: plum, cinnamon, leather accord, violet, birch woods, patchouli, vanilla

"Sabrina exudes an epic combination of poise, thoughtfulness, and focus. She's incredibly hard-working and has a rare, gentle and kind disposition that instantly puts you at ease—which can be a bit of a magic trick when you work in a fast-paced industry like ours! Byredo's Bibliothèque is such a classically lovely scent, and it's one I associate with comfort and warmth, just like Sabrina's wonderful aura." — Jahns

Maya Thomas is an Associate Beauty Editor at Who What Wear. Her strong love for all things beauty and fashion stems from a strong childhood interest in the fine arts. During a gap year spent in Paris studying the history of French fashion, she shifted her focus to English literature and journalism as a student at Loyola Marymount University. After graduating in May 2021, Maya began freelancing for Parade.com as a contributing commerce writer. When she's not writing, Maya spends her free time catching up on reading, perusing art galleries, and enjoying a night out at the ballet every now and then.
